abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            building a better growth foundation in Mali. Mali is a vast
            landlocked country located in the heart of the Sahel, a
            region threatened by drought and desertification. The vast
            majority of the people were directly dependent on the
            environment for their livelihoods through herding, farming,
            or fishing. The International Development Association
            supported Mali through various projects, in addressing its
            economic challenges with a focus on education, health,
            agriculture, and energy. The Fostering Agricultural
            Productivity Project improved productivity of targeted
            horticultural and livestock products and better access to
            markets, financing, and commercial infrastructure. Energy
            Support Project increased access to electricity through the
            interconnected network and promoted regional integration and
            energy diversification
